q: Tem Dwaine Caraway gave a`` key to the city'' to Michael Vick . The action spawned outrage from many North Texans( including NBCDFW Mayor Tom Tom Leppert releasing the following statement on Monday afternoon: The action taken was not sanctioned by my office and was not an official ceremonial honor on behalf of the City of Dallas. Official Keys to the City are presented by the Mayor Tom , or an elected official designated by the Mayor Tom , and reserved, on a limited basis, for an elected official of international status. Clearly, this was not the case in this situation and done without my knowledge or approval. Given these circumstances I have requested the City Manager propose guidelines to prevent this situation in the future. the main trust of the disturbance appeared to be who would be forced to sit with Connecticut Senator Joe Lieberman . Unnamed White House Spokesman Wegman( Pudgy) Waterhouse, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said, It was wild there for a bit... everybody was cool at first. Lamar Alexander sort of paired up with Mike Lee Bennet, Maria Cantwell sat with Barbara Boxer and Scott Brown , Orrin Hatch plumped down next to Jeanne Shaheen ... I think Orrin Hatch was feeling lonely and he's always had a kind of thing for her... anyway, it was going okay, ya know? Then Joe Lieberman walked in and tried to sit next to Al Franken . That's when the shit started. if you count Yahoo, and Eric Schmidt recently said in Davos that Facebook is not competition, that it has no intention of going into search. On its face, it seems like a very lopsided duopoly. From my perspective, competition is always a click away. If we don't do the right thing by our users, it takes one word in their browser bar to go to another search engine. We don't even know how the information seeking model will evolve. What you may not think of as competitive today, might very well become the new way of seeking information.
